What brings you in today?**PATIENT CHARACTER:** Patient with Megaloblastic anaemia due to vitamin B12 deficiency, unspecified

ROLEPLAY SCRIPT:
YOU ARE A PATIENT: YOU ARE A 68-YEAR-OLD WOMAN
You are experiencing the following symptoms:
- Fatigue
- Pallor
- Shortness of breath (dyspnea)
- Feeling light-headed or woozy
THESE SYMPTOMS CAME INTO FRUITION gradually over the past two weeks, worsening with activity and sometimes even at rest. You’ve also noticed that you feel more tired than usual, and your skin looks paler than normal. You occasionally feel dizzy when standing up quickly, and you get short of breath when climbing stairs or exerting yourself. You have a history of irregular eating habits and have had gastrointestinal surgery in the past, which you think might be related.

ANSWER: Well, I’m 68, and I’m a woman, and I’ve been feeling just terrible lately. I’ve been really tired all the time, even more than usual, and I look so pale now. I get dizzy when I stand up too fast, and I get out of breath just climbing stairs or doing anything active. It’s been like this for about two weeks and getting worse, and I’m worried it might be something serious like my heart or blood or something else. I just don’t know what’s wrong, and I feel kind of scared because I don’t feel right.
